channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: An unbearable situation: How a nonprofit helped evict a black bear in LA
item.description: A black bear made a home for itself underneath a Los Angeles man's home weeks ago. He called in expert bear-evictors to solve the problem.
item.content:encoded: A black bear made a home for itself underneath a Los Angeles man's home weeks ago. He called in expert bear-evictors to solve the problem.
item.dc:creator: Henry Larson

item.title: Why nearly 15,000 nurses in New York City are going on strike
item.description: Nearly 15,000 New York City nurses are on strike demanding things like higher wages and more security in hospitals. The head of the of the New York State Nurses Association talks about the next steps.
item.content:encoded: Nearly 15,000 New York City nurses are on strike demanding things like higher wages and more security in hospitals. The head of the of the New York State Nurses Association talks about the next steps.
item.dc:creator: Matt Ozug

item.title: Minnesota steps up its resistance to the Trump Administration's surge of ICE officers
item.description: A snapshot of ICE actions around Minneapolis Monday, and the various ways the community is responding.
item.content:encoded: A snapshot of ICE actions around Minneapolis Monday, and the various ways the community is responding.
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson

item.title: Maduro's gone, but Venezuela's human rights crisis remains
item.description: The fallout from the US attack on Venezuela and the focus on oil interests have largely eclipsed urgent concerns about the country's entrenched human rights abuses and democratic erosion.
item.content:encoded: The fallout from the US attack on Venezuela and the focus on oil interests have largely eclipsed urgent concerns about the country's entrenched human rights abuses and democratic erosion.
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: Lost overnight, a 6-year-old was found by a man who ignored search teams' advice
item.description: When he was 6 years old, Thomas Sinclair wandered away from his family's campsite on Lake Superior and got lost. At dawn he heard a voice that has shaped his life ever since.
item.content:encoded: When he was 6 years old, Thomas Sinclair wandered away from his family's campsite on Lake Superior and got lost. At dawn he heard a voice that has shaped his life ever since.

item.title: Fed Chair Jerome Powell stands up to Trump
item.description: Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell usually tries to avoid getting dragged into a fight with the Trump administration. But now that the DOJ has launched a probe of the central bank, he's on offense.
item.content:encoded: Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell usually tries to avoid getting dragged into a fight with the Trump administration. But now that the DOJ has launched a probe of the central bank, he's on offense.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Iran cracks down on protestors, Trump mulls US options
item.description: Iran's government is cracking down hard on massive street protests. The number of demonstrators killed is believed to be soaring. Meanwhile, President Trump keeps suggesting the U.S. may get involved.
item.content:encoded: Iran's government is cracking down hard on massive street protests. The number of demonstrators killed is believed to be soaring. Meanwhile, President Trump keeps suggesting the U.S. may get involved.
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: Trump doubles down on Iran threat — but also offers talks — as protest spreads
item.description: President Trump doubles down on Iran threats as protests become deadlier, but also offers talks.
item.content:encoded: President Trump doubles down on Iran threats as protests become deadlier, but also offers talks.
item.dc:creator: Ruth Sherlock

item.title: Poet Amanda Gorman on her work, 'For Renee Nicole Good'
item.description: Poet Amanda Gorman wrote a poem for Renee Good, who was killed by an ICE officer this week. Gorman reads her poem and speaks on its meaning.
item.content:encoded: Poet Amanda Gorman wrote a poem for Renee Good, who was killed by an ICE officer this week. Gorman reads her poem and speaks on its meaning.
item.dc:creator: Jordan-Marie Smith

item.title: 'Hope. Hope. Hope.' How Gabby Giffords keeps fighting for change.
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with former Arizona Congresswoman Gabby Giffords and Giffords Executive Director Emma Brown about their efforts to stop gun violence.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with former Arizona Congresswoman Gabby Giffords and Giffords Executive Director Emma Brown about their efforts to stop gun violence.
item.dc:creator: Elena Burnett
